result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall J. LOUISON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Domestic violence assessment and counseling.

Have no contact with the victim, Linda Louison, defendant must maintain a distance of 500 feet away from the victim.   Defendant must move away within the next 45 days from his current residence.  Exceptions to the no contact are if the victim comes toward him; contact in court for divorce proceedings; and incidental contact.  

Attend batterer's treatment group.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-11-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
RE:  Linda Louison, on 01-14-15.

ADDRESS INFO for Randall J. LOUISON
Current: 2119 Jackson Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 01-16-2015)
Prior: 520 E. Main Street, Mishicot, WI 54228

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of substantial battery-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-02-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Linda L. Louison or her residence at 520 E. Main Street, Mishicot, WI.  A one time contact with the residence to allow defendant to retrieve personal belongings with police escort is allowed.  Defendant is also to maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
